author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: [Redemption💭] Our #Oppressor is #addicted to #power like we are #addicted to #freedom. Both are afraid to exist without what they desire. We are experiencing an #illusion. Àse

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text:
a Shamans Shadow: “We empathize with the traumatized Creator, and see our-Self as a traumatized Creator.”
#MyShadow #Trauma #aShamaninJourney #Christopher https://t.co/WPiw1DN8uR

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text:
A Shamans Inner Truth: "We are not just of God, but we are All things that make God."
#aRelationalGod #Being #aShamaninJourney #Creation #MutualImminence https://t.co/CqbSLU6xYw

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: We yearn to understand our #Self. Just a cm to the left or right is #ecstasy. We #imagine a coupled Fish reflecting hues of blue. #Swimming the waves of #TimeSpace. Being catapulted by the gravity of nearby #Stars. We are in #Journey. 🧘🏽‍♂️💭♓️

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: #Swell on #Feelings, #Energies, & #Colors that reflect our #Shadow. https://t.co/hXxaq5NR0x

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text:
a Shamans Shadow:"We were supposed to be a perfect painting painted by an imperfect artist." We were expected to be an adult as a child, be everything our Mother couldn’t be; We were expected to be perfect, without flaw.”
#MyShadow #Perfection #aShamaninJourney #Christopher https://t.co/W6vsndkTM4

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: If you have 2-3 hours to #invest in your #Self, consider reading thru this CIA document that was declassified in 2017. 🙏🏽💭🧘🏽‍♂️ https://t.co/cxTlMg1Kh0

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: "What happens after the deconstruction?" https://t.co/fTkM2dS63c via @StudyReligion

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: A Shamans Inner Truth: “The birthing of the Cosmos was traumatic for God, a trauma that will not be healed unless we begin healing Self.” #aRelationalGod #Traumatized #aShamaninJourney #WoundedHealer https://t.co/VjA0eeYxrS

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text:
a Shamans Shadow: "The moment we saw our Mother is the first time we experienced Love." Our Mother Loved us & that’s why She beat us. Our Mother would tell us: “I hit you because I Love you Baby.” 
#MyShadow #Mother #aShamaninJourney #Christopher https://t.co/MO7wvWvyb4

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: Thank you @pkrealbriggster for creating the space of thought 💭 that speaks to: #Spirituality #Imagination #SocialCapital #Community & #Humanity https://t.co/TvWiNixPmq

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: https://t.co/KdZmmn66KD “ How does #inflation affect our #Spirituality ?

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: A #Buddha has returned form the #Wilderness. A #Christ has #Risen. A #Sun was released from #Darkness. A new #Success has come out of past #failures. A #Shaman learns something new about #Self.

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: Today we shared #time w/ people & evoked smiling, laughing & #Self reflection. A modern day #miracle. Sometimes we just need to be brave enough to be #Human. #WeChoose

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: We #think Queer, therefore we are #Queer.

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: We support #BooksForAll and stand with @NYPL to defend the right to read #BannedBooks. Learn more: https://t.co/LaM7IiN3pR

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: While in meditation, we catch our #Self #concerned about #others & their #suffering. We may feel at peace temporarily but apart of me is concerned about others. We wonder to our Self if that is #God in us that is constantly worried about others?

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: Just cuz we identify as a #Shaman in Journey, doesn’t mean we are perfect. It means we are & have been experiencing #trauma but we choose to use our #wounds & #suffering to help others. We have nothing to prove because we are.

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: We felt #hurt when we left the Church. We felt #lost & #disconnected. Then we found #community in the wilderness. We became a part of a #Tribe that accepts us as is. We found our #Self within the #Wilderness. Áse

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: We have become an unclassified #LivingSymbol, #homeless in society & in a constant state of migration: #exiled. Yet, we are living #authentically in #community: #Tribe.

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: Some of us think so terribly of our #Self: we hold God hostage inside of us, not allowing the most #beautiful part of us to come into the dark cold world. Allow the inner #Light of the Cosmos an opportunity to work through you.

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: Some of us are experiencing unimaginable suffering & struggle to see our own value and or beauty. It deeply pains us to witness others be blind to their #uniqueness. We empathize with you & encourage you to be patient with your #Self .

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: The Theme of my Path: “Who Are You?” https://t.co/W5HXYYFTN0

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: [The Venus in #Pisces until April 12th] “The Oceans of Neptune are suitable for deep diving & vulnerable #Self reflection. We look forward to what we reveal from the deep Abyss of our #Spirit .”

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: Church reminds me of my Altar: a space of safety, reflection & inspiration. Only significant difference is that my Altar reflects Self & Church reflects doctrine. We choose to embody a Living Breathing Altar.

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: [Addiction] a chronic relationship characterized by compulsive seeking, despite harmful consequences & long-lasting affects in the mind. We are addicted to God: Life.

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: We honor those who have stopped or slowed down form their challenging path of life to offer water to those who are thirsty or just ran out of water. Thank you🙏🏽

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: He signed two of our books. We broke bread with him twice and we laughed together several times. We remember Dr. Norman K. Gottwald for his inquisitive mind- a Copernicus of his time. We hope to build a better tomorrow with the foundational thoughts he contributed to humanity. https://t.co/t4p70agEpA

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: “Perseverance in Community” 2022 https://t.co/wBlpGPkTdA

text: A meditation on “Forgiving Self.” https://t.co/PJ5g6adiDz

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: Apparently today is Valentine’s Day…. So we meditate on everyone loving themSelf today. Don’t wait for love but instead become love. We love you Tribe!🙏🏽❤️💯 #lovethySelf

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: “A little can go a long way.” https://t.co/f8yAvBXxLE

author: Aaron C. Waldron
text: We are in the pits of our soul, wandering aimlessly like a person looking for a light switch in complete darkness. We are in Journey.
